data.event: La Ceiba was officially founded on August 23, 1877.

event.title: fell into the sea in late 2007

data.event: The city was named after a giant ceiba tree which grew near the old dock, which itself finally fell into the sea in late 2007.
Every year, on the third or fourth Saturday of May, the city holds its famous carnival to commemorate Isidore the Laborer (Spanish San Isidro Labrador).
In 1872 Manuel Hernandez built a small shack under the Ceiba tree that was at one point by the old docks.

event.title: were built by the Standard Fruit Company (now

data.event: These train tracks were built by the Standard Fruit Company (now Standard Fruit de Honduras, a Dole subsidiary).
